# Cloud Provider Playbook: Google Cloud Platform (gcp)

1. Prerequisites
   1. A domain e.g. `my-app.com` (`<fqdn>`). Preferably in Google Domains or Cloud Domains because there's slightly fewer steps, but not necessary)
      - The domain is referenced here as `<fqdn>` (fully qualified domain name)
      - This domain will serve your website/API root (index.html).
   2. A google account associated with an [organization](https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/quickstart-organizations), also with administrative rights to the organization. You can create an organization through [G-Suite](https://gsuite.google.com/), which costs money, or for free with a [Cloud Identity](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/migrating-to-cloud-identity).
2. Google Cloud Platform provider (`gcp`) setup:
   1. `just cloud/lib/provider/gcp/initialize`
      1. creates ‚û° `cloud/env/.provider/gcp/organization.json` (encrypted provider data required by deployments)
         - üëç committed
      2. creates ‚û° `cloud/env/.provider/gcp/terraform-admin.json` (downloaded credential for the terraform service account)
         - ‚ö† NOT committed (git ignored)
         - `terraform-admin.json` content is added to CI secrets to authorize deployments in
           - TODO: document where secret goes for Github Actions
           - TODO: deploy via github actions
3. Create/Update/Destroy cycle:
   - Create deployment:
      1. `just cloud/create <provider> <fqdn>`
         - creates a new deployment config (but doesn't apply it) config at the `<fqdn>` e.g. prod.company.com
         - follow further CLI instructions
      2. `cd cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp`
      3. ‚úã manual step ‚úã: create the `project` first so that the OAuth credentials can be created and consumed:
         1. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just project/apply`
           - [Internal OAuth credentials can be created, but not external (yet)](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/iap_client)
           - [Also no datasource  for the client credentials](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-google/issues/6482)
         2. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/>  just project/extra console_set_up_oauth`: open this URL provided by this command in your browser
            1. Click: `+ CREATE CREDENTIALS`
            2. Select: `OAuth client ID`
            3. Application type: `Web application`
            4. `Name`: anything you like, but recommended: the FQDN (domain name of the app)
            5. `Authorized JavaScript origins`: empty
            6. `Authorized redirect URIs:`:
               - https://oauth.<fqdn>:443/auth
                 - NB: the port is added here since it can be modified when developing locally (multiple concurrent stacks on your dev machine)
            7. "Create" (TODO: what is the name of the exact button?)
            8. Copy "Your Client ID" and "Your Client Secret" values
            9. Create file `cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/vouch/secrets.encrypted.json`
               - Content: `{"oauth_client_id":"<Your Client ID>", "oauth_client_secret":"<Your Client Secret>"}`
            10. Encrypt file: `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just provider encrypt $PWD/vouch/secrets.encrypted.json`
      4. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just apply`
         1. Handles the initial creation of resources where the creation order matters
      5. Set up DNS:
         1. Go [here](https://www.google.com/webmasters/verification/home)
         2. Select the domain
         3. Tap the "Add an owner" button at the bottom of the page and add the email address (e.g. `cloudseed-terraform-admin@<TERRAFORM_PROJECT>.iam.gserviceaccount.com`)
         4. Update DNS records: https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/mapping-custom-domains#dns_update
            - Get the `projectId` for the next step: `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just project_id`
            - To get the DNS entry:
               - Run: `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just domain_mappings`
               - The `resourceRecords` key has the exact DNS record you need to add at your domain register, e.g.:
               ```
                   "resourceRecords": [
                     {
                       "name": "test2",
                       "rrdata": "ghs.googlehosted.com.",
                       "type": "CNAME"
                     }
                   ]
               ```
   - Iterate on deployment:
      1. Commit changes
      2. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just apply`
         - builds and pushes images before updating the terraform configs with the git sha of docker containers
   - Destroy:
      1. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/> just cloud/env/<fqdn>/gcp/destroy`
      2. `<cloud/env/<fqdn>/> rm -rf gcp`



 ## Glossary

 ### `root account`

 E.g. `<yourname>`@yoursite.com

This account creates the terraform admin project. The terraform admin project has a service account, and the service account creates all the other deployments (each its own project).
